What happens when a screenwriter turns his own creative crisis into the script itself? Adaptation isn’t just a film — it’s a paradox. A story about the impossibility of writing a story. In this video, we explore how Charlie Kaufman managed to fool the studio into letting him make a movie about himself, his doubts, and his obsession with originality — and somehow got away with it.

From Nicolas Cage’s double performance to Spike Jonze’s direction, Adaptation remains one of the most self-aware films ever made — one that blurs the line between writer and character, reality and fiction.
title: He literally fooled them into making a movie about himself.
